Then, one night, an unexpected intruder arrived at the castle, seeking shelter from the bitter storm. As a gift, she offered the Prince a single rose.
The PRINCE'S HAND waves her off.    The woman begs on her The Prince motions to the staff. NARRATOR (V.O.)

Repulsed by her haggard appearance, the Prince turned the woman away. But she warned him not to be deceived by appearances, for beauty is found within. The majordomo and footman approach to usher her out.   Th lowers her head as if to cry -- NARRATOR (V.O.)

The Prince tried to apologize but it was too late. For she had seen that there was no love in his heart. As the Prince begs for mercy, his body begins to transfor His jewelry pops off. His clothing rips as he grows large NARRATOR (V.O.)

As punishment, she transformed him into a hideous beast... The guests scream in horror and flee. But pushing his way through the crowd, A YOUNG BOY slips into the ballroom, watching in wonder as -- the PRINCE'S SHADOW twists into SHADOW OF A HIDEOUS BEAST. Chip!   Chip! Oh my... -- just as the doors slam shut, leaving the staff, the entertainers and the dog trapped in the room. NARRATOR (V.O.)
... and placed a powerful spell on the castle and all who lived there.
CLOSE ON a portrait of the handsome prince -- as the beas giant paw slashes it.
Years later, the enchanted castle stands isolated. The property is surrounded by an ice hedge. The only sound is grim winter wind. As we move closer:
As days bled into years, the Prince and his servants were forgotten by the world. For the Enchantress had erased all memory of them from the minds of the people they loved.
At the highest window of the west wing, we see THE BEAST. ROSE, already wilting, floats before him. To protect it, beast has covered it with a glass bell jar.

But the rose she had offered was truly an enchanted rose. If he could learn to love another and earn their love in return by the time the last petal fell, the spell would be broken. If not, he would be doomed to remain a beast for all time. TIGHT ON THE ROSE -- another petal drops.
As the years passed, he fell into despair and lost all hope. For who could ever learn to love a beast?
